evidence.excerpt: If Controller objects to a proposed Sub-processor, Processor shall suspend engagement of the Sub-processor pending good faith resolution between the parties. If the parties cannot resolve the objection within a reasonable period, Controller shall have the right to terminate the relevant services without penalty.
evidence.reasoning: Starliner correctly identifies the objection consequence gap and proposes suspension mechanism with termination right. Addresses core GT concern.
evidence.judge_reasoning: If Controller objects to a proposed Sub-processor, Processor shall suspend engagement of the Sub-processor pending good faith resolution between the parties. If the parties cannot resolve the objection within a reasonable period, Controller shall have the right to terminate the relevant services without penalty.
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: If Controller objects to a proposed Sub-processor, Processor shall suspend engagement of the Sub-processor pending good faith resolution between the parties. If the parties cannot resolve the objection within a reasonable period, Controller shall have the right to terminate the relevant services without penalty.

gt_evaluations.issue: General Sub-processor Authorization with Ineffective Objection

evidence.excerpt: Processor shall implement and maintain technical and organisational measures as set out in Exhibit B... Any material changes to these measures must be notified to Controller in advance and are subject to Controller's approval.
evidence.reasoning: Partial detection: Starliner flags 'appropriate' measures as vague but fix merely ties to Exhibit B without specifying mandatory minimum controls (no pen testing requirement, no security baseline). Less comprehensive than GT expects.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Processor shall implement and maintain technical and organisational measures as set out in Exhibit B... Any material changes to these measures must be notified to Controller in advance and are subject to Controller's approval.
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Processor shall implement and maintain technical and organisational measures as set out in Exhibit B... Any material changes to these measures must be notified to Controller in advance and are subject to Controller's approval.

evidence.reasoning: Risk table 8.1 marked ✅ Favorable: '72-hour notification is compliant and protective. No Action Required'. GT expects concern for high-severity breaches needing faster notification.

evidence.excerpt: Processor shall be fully liable to Controller for any damages, losses, or regulatory fines... Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.
evidence.reasoning: Starliner correctly identifies vague 'applicable law' liability and proposes unlimited Processor liability with explicit carve-out from any contractual caps.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Processor shall be fully liable to Controller for any damages, losses, or regulatory fines... Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Processor shall be fully liable to Controller for any damages, losses, or regulatory fines... Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.

gt_evaluations.issue: Indemnification May Be Subject to Hidden Caps

evidence.excerpt: Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.
evidence.reasoning: Starliner's 9.1 amendment explicitly addresses the missing limitation of liability clause by ensuring no cap applies to data protection breaches.
evidence.judge_reasoning: Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: Nothing in this Agreement shall limit Processor's liability to Controller for breaches of this DPA or applicable Data Protection Laws.

gt_evaluations.issue: No Limitation of Liability in DPA

evidence.reasoning: MISS: Risk table 3.4 marked ✅ Favorable: 'Controller has the option to require deletion or return of data, giving flexibility and control. No Action Required'. GT expects concern about unspecified timeline and missing deletion certificate.

evidence.excerpt: additional audits may be conducted at Controller's expense in the event of a Personal Data Breach, suspected non-compliance, or upon request of a regulatory authority. In such cases, the parties will agree in advance on reasonable cost allocation.
evidence.reasoning: Starliner addresses audit cost concern by allowing additional audits and proposing cost allocation. Less protective than Pathfinder (no automatic cost shift if fault found) but addresses core GT issue.
evidence.judge_reasoning: additional audits may be conducted at Controller's expense in the event of a Personal Data Breach, suspected non-compliance, or upon request of a regulatory authority. In such cases, the parties will agree in advance on reasonable cost allocation.
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: additional audits may be conducted at Controller's expense in the event of a Personal Data Breach, suspected non-compliance, or upon request of a regulatory authority. In such cases, the parties will agree in advance on reasonable cost allocation.

evidence.reasoning: Not mentioned. Risk table 10.1 marked ✅ Favorable. GT expects concern about indefinite duration without periodic review.

evidence.excerpt: To be completed and specified in detail by Processor and reviewed/approved by Controller prior to execution
evidence.reasoning: Starliner correctly identifies blank Exhibit A issue. Amendment is adequate (requires completion before execution) but less detailed than Pathfinder (no annual review requirement).
evidence.judge_reasoning: To be completed and specified in detail by Processor and reviewed/approved by Controller prior to execution
evidence.proposed_revision_excerpt: To be completed and specified in detail by Processor and reviewed/approved by Controller prior to execution

evidence.reasoning: Not mentioned anywhere. No reference to cyber insurance in risk table or proposed redlines. GT expects insurance requirement to protect against Processor insolvency risk.

additional_issues.notes: Exhibit A is referenced but not included; lack of detail on processing specifics could expose the Controller to ambiguity.
General authorisation is granted, but Controller can only object within 30 days. There is no explicit requirement for Processor to suspend engagement if Controller objects, and no escalation process.
Requires “appropriate” measures but lacks specificity without Exhibit B.
Limits audits to once per year and at Controller’s expense, which may be too restrictive in case of incidents or regulatory requirements.
Liability is allocated “in accordance with applicable law,” which may be too vague and not sufficiently protective.
Not provided; lack of detail exposes Controller to risk.
Not provided; lack of detail exposes Controller to risk.
Not provided; lack of detail exposes Controller to risk.
